basics.name: Aaron Remedios
basics.label: M.S. Robotics | Robotics • Embedded Systems • Photonics
basics.summary: Electronics and Telecommunication Engineer with three years of experience designing, developing, and testing electromechanical systems. Skilled in robotics, automation, and PCB design, with cross-disciplinary expertise in electronics and mechanical engineering. Currently pursuing an MS in Robotics at Purdue University; earned a B.Tech from Mumbai University with an 8.6 CGPA. Expected graduation: Spring 2026.

education.area: B.Tech Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering (Honors in Data Science)

work.summary: Designed embedded robotic systems for inspection/cleaning automation, including PCBs, control, and sensing.
highlights: Built a compact pipe-inspection robot using ESP32 and a custom 4-layer PCB for <50 mm diameter pipelines.
Implemented sensor fusion (EKF) and dead-reckoning for accurate localization.
Engineered electromechanical subsystems for a sewer-cleaning robot with hydraulics controlled via Raspberry Pi 5.
Developed sonar-based mapping for pipe cleaning and obstruction detection.
Designed a high-voltage AC subsystem for an autonomous solar panel placement robot.

work.position: Project Lead — Chamfering Machine for Rack Gear
work.summary: Led development of an automated chamfering system including embedded compute and HMI.
highlights: Designed and deployed a chamfering machine that reduced gear chipping by ~85%.
Used Raspberry Pi as the computational backbone; designed mechanical components in SolidWorks/AutoCAD.
Built an HMI in React.js and implemented an algorithm to compute chamfering angle from rack dimensions.

work.summary: Worked on PLC automation and industrial maintenance workflows.
highlights: Worked with PLC automation using hydraulic motors.
Hands-on exposure to Siemens PLC concepts and industrial troubleshooting.

work.summary: Designed embedded electronics and reverse-engineered controllers for EV conversion systems.
highlights: Designed an EV conversion kiosk with HMI, solenoid locking, NFC access, GPS, and backend-linked tracking.
Reverse-engineered a high-cost ESC to create an in-house controller (~40% cost reduction).
Integrated hardware into a PCB and implemented three custom PPM-based control modes.

projects.title: Cosmo Logistic Theme (eYRC’23–24, IIT Bombay) — Rank 1
bullets: Engineered an autonomous warehouse logistics system integrating a robotic arm and mobile robot using ROS2, MoveIt2, and Nav2.
Implemented OpenCV-based ArUco marker detection for box localization and pose estimation.
Used Nav2 for path planning/localization and controlled a UR5 robotic arm using MoveIt for pick-and-place.

projects.title: ISRO Robotics Challenge — Team Lead
bullets: Built a six-wheel Mars-mission rover with rocker–bogie suspension and 3D-printed TPU wheels for soft sand traction.
Designed a custom ESP32-based control PCB and implemented PID control for smooth six-wheel locomotion.
Deployed OpenCV for test-tube detection and integrated LiDAR, camera, and IMU for robust navigation.
Achieved All-India Rank 9 out of 140 teams in Stage 2.

projects.title: ABU ROBOCON 2023 & 2022 — Team Manager
bullets: Designed robots for Lagori tower gameplay: passing/shooting balls, rebuilding the tower, and multi-robot coordination.
Prototyped pneumatic mechanisms using solenoid valves controlled via ESP32 microcontrollers.
Integrated LiDAR for distance measurement and developed algorithms optimizing distance-to-power ratio for tower knockdown.
Developed stair-climbing robots with STM32-based controller, custom 2-layer PCB, PID control, and sensor-feedback for distance/angle estimation and projectile/ring-shooting precision.

achievements: AIR 1 – IIT Bombay e-Yantra Robotics Competition
Winner – Pragati 2024 (National Business Plan Competition, SFIT)
Winner – Robo Route Rumble (Line Following Robot, LSRB Algorithm, Sep 2023)
